result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Eugene McFaggen

defendant.name: McFaggen, Gerald Eugene
defendant.address: 23855 County Road H, Shell Lake, WI 54871

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Cases 21CF271, 21CM227, 21CM262, and 22CF34 called together.  Defendant, Gerald Eugene McFaggen, appeared with Attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  21CF271 set for plea hearing.  All other cases on for an initial appearance and plea hearing.  Cases 21CM227, 21CM262, and 21CF34 on for an Initial Appearance.  State notes all cases to resolve today, remaining counts not plead to will be DRI.  Cases proceed to plea hearing.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Harrington: def pleading to amended Count 1: possession of amphetamine and Counts 1 of 21CM227 and 21CM262: possession of drug paraphernalia; joint recommendation of a withheld sentence, 2 years probation with various conditions.  State moves to amend Count 1 of 21CF271 to possession of amphetamine, Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Off the record 11:12 AM.  Back on the record 11:13 AM, same appearances.  Off the record 11:13 AM.  Back on the record 11:14 AM, same appearances.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plesa knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 of 21CF271 (as amended), 21CM227, and 21CM262 and orders a JOC; 22CF34 and remaining counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  

Court orders:
21CF271- 2 yrs probation; imposed-stayed 1 year jail $443 court costs
21CM227- 2 yrs probation; imposed-stayed 30 days jail, consecutive to 21CF271 $200 DNA
21CM262- 2 yrs probation; imposed-stayed 30 days jail, consecutive to 21CF271 and 21CM227 $200 DNA
Conditions of probation:
The defendant shall complete all programming required by the Department of Corrections.  Regular drug testing.  AODA follow-through.  Curfew of 11 pm- 7am, except for employment purposes.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Def to pay probation at $25 per month.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
